## Enumerations

### enum class  {#a600545eb53de812fc4daae8ecb72199d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>enum class anonymous_namespace&#123;SLPVectorizer.cpp&#125;::UseMask </>}
 labels = {["strong"]}>
Specifies the way the mask should be analyzed for undefs/poisonous elements in the shuffle mask.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a600545eb53de812fc4daae8ecb72199da8545ba2c4d270d3cca72fb93da2a21d8" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FirstArg">
The mask is expected to be for permutation of 1-2 vectors, check for the mask elements for the first argument (mask indices are in range &#91;0:VF))
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a600545eb53de812fc4daae8ecb72199da018f3de8f2e77f6f34af68e83516cb9f" />
<EnumerationListItem name="SecondArg">
The mask is expected to be for permutation of 2 vectors, check for the mask elements for the second argument (mask indices are in range &#91;VF:2&#42;VF))
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a600545eb53de812fc4daae8ecb72199da3e1e09be16e530770bc81cd5f2b2edb9" />
<EnumerationListItem name="UndefsAsMask">
Consider undef mask elements (-1) as placeholders for future shuffle elements and mark them as ones as being used in future
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

</MemberDefinition>
